thread.title: Dawn Princess cruise ship will have 63 whiskies in new concept bar
thread.title_full: Dawn Princess cruise ship will have 63 whiskies in new concept bar | Travel | Travel News and Holiday Deals | | The Courier-Mail

author: couriermail.com.au
title: Dawn Princess cruise ship will have 63 whiskies in new concept bar
text:
Ph 13 24 88 or see princess.com
A new dawn at the bar ... the Dawn Princess will have 63 different whiskies. Picture: Supplied Source: Supplied
SILVERSEA’S FLAGSHIP
SILVERSEA Cruises has announced a new flagship, the Silver Muse, to be delivered in April 2017. The luxury ship is being built by Fincantieri in Italy and will accommodate 596 guests. The addition of the Silver Muse will expand Silversea’s fleet to nine ships.
“We always had a special relationship with Fincantieri, since my father ordered the first cruise vessels for Sitmar in 1987,” Silversea chairman Manfredi Lefebvre d’Ovidio said. “Both companies have a clear understanding of what today’s affluent traveller seeks, and each approaches the market with originality, creativity and quality.”
AN AUSTRALIAN FIRST
A RECENT item about P&O Cruises’ Pacific Jewel calling at Dili in East Timor should have specified it was the first major Australian-based cruise ship to call there. Guests sailing aboard the cruise ship Funchal recall calling there before Jewel’s visit.
On-board credit ... when you book a trip with the Royal Caribbean International cruise ship Explorer of the Seas. Picture: Supplied Source: Supplied
BALCONY UPGRADE
ENJOY your own private balcony for the price of an interior stateroom on your next cruise holiday with Royal Caribbean’s free balcony upgrade offer, valid for new bookings on select Asia, Australia, New Zealand and South Pacific voyages that depart between next month and April 2016, when booked and deposited before July 31. Plus, for guests who choose to holiday on the recently revitalised Explorer of the Seas, Royal Caribbean will offer a bonus $US200 on-board credit for sailings that depart between November 3 and April 23. For example Explorer of the Seas’
16-night voyage from Fremantle to Sydney, departing November 13 and priced from $1799 a person, twin share, includes the upgrade and on-board credit. The cruise calls at Adelaide, Melbourne, Milford, Dusky and Doubtful sounds, Dunedin, Wellington and Picton.
Ph 1800 754 500 or see royalcaribbean.com.au
GALAPAGOS OFFERINGS
EXPLORE Ecuador’s Galápagos Islands with Lindblad Expeditions-National Geographic and receive $500 air credit a person plus free flights to the islands from the mainland if bookings on select departures are made by August 30, 2015. The nine-night expeditions on the 96-guest National Geographic Endeavour or the intimate 48-guest National Geographic Islander calls at Bartolome, Santiago, Santa Cruz, Fernandina and Espanola and are priced from $6990 a person, twin share. The package includes seven nights on board and one night’s pre and post-cruise accommodation in either Guayaquil or Quito in mainland Ecuador. Bookings for the year-round cruises made before August 30, 2015, on selected departures from August 20-December 15, 2015, will attract $500 air credit a person plus complimentary return flights from the mainland of Ecuador to the Galapagos.
Ph 1300 361 012 or see au.expeditions.com
Cruise the Galapagos ... a sea lion spotted at the Galapagos Islands National Park in Ecuador. Picture: Supplied Source: Supplied
SEE MED IN STYLE
CRUISE the Mediterranean on a 34-night itinerary aboard the luxurious Azamara Journey. Departing Nice on April 20, 2016, guests will visit unusual destinations along the way
to Venice. The 30 port stops include Sanary Sur Mer on the Riviera, Sete, where guests can take an optional tour to the World Heritage Listed walled city of Carcasonne, Olbia on Sardinia and Trapani. Prices start from $11,500 a person, twin share.
Ph (02) 9492 8520 or see cruising.com.au
AIRFARE DISCOUNTS
AVALON’S discounted airfares have been extended for sale until September 15, 2015, or until sold out, and are available with any 2016 Avalon Waterways European river cruise booking.
Flying with Emirates, Etihad Airways, Cathay Pacific or Singapore Airlines, the fares are priced from $799 a person (including taxes) for travel between March and May or September and November, 2016.
Fares are also available from $999 (including taxes) for travel between June and August, 2016.
Flights depart from Brisbane to a range of European gateways.
Avalon has also waived single supplements across its entire 2016 season of European river cruises.
Until September 15, 2015, or until sold out, solo travellers can book category D and E cabins aboard any Avalon Waterways 2016 European departure and pay the same per-person price as a couple sharing.
The offer represents a saving of up to $6496 on some cruises. Avalon’s European river cruises range from eight to 24 days and are available from $2264 a person twin share (or with
single supplement waiver) for the eight-day A Taste of the Danube between Vienna
and Budapest.
Ph 1300 230 234 or see avalonwaterways.com.au
